page.title: 19DOMESDAY 1086-1986,02320054
page.content: AS IN 1086 THIS AREA IS OCCUPIED MAINLY FOR AGRICULTURE,ALTHOUGH LARGE AREAS FORMERLY WOODLAND AND WASTE ARE NOW CULTIVATED.YIELDS- GRAIN AND GRASSLAND - HAVE INCREASED BY ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS AND IMPROVED VARIETIES. SMALLER FARMS HAVE AMALGAMATED - TRIFFLE HAS ABSORBED JERICHO, INTOWN,KELLOW, EGLAROOSE, LONGCOLLING, COBLAND,BOOTOWN,E.UNDERTOWN, CARGLOTH, TREGUNNUS AND TREGUNNUS MILL. TREWALL AND ST. WINNOLS ARE DOMESDAY MANORS.ST. WINNOLLS IS ALSO THE PROBABLE SITE OF A CELTIC CHAPEL. COBLAND HILL & PROBABLY TRIFFLE ARE PRE-ARMADA BEACONS.BARROWS ARE FOUND AT TRIFFLE(OVAL),CARGLOTH & TREWRICKLE (ROUND) & COBLAND HILL. AT THE ENTRANCE TO TRIFFLE ARE REMAINS OF OLD STONE CROSS.AT EGLAROOSE IS THE SITE OF A DOVECOTE.
